metadata.title: CVE-2017-2504 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3.2 isaffected. Safari before 10.1.1 is affected. tvOS before 10.2.1 is affected.The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers toconduct Universal XSS (UXSS) attacks via a crafted web site that improperlyinteracts with WebKit Editor commands.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.2-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.2-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.2-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.2-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.16.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.2-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
